A80A9CD40D5B4861885808944C202563.description: maintain an up-to-date portfolio that includes pieces of work and other materials that provide evidence of their skills and achievements in computer technology (e.g., Passport to Safety certificate, OSP Work Plan, OSP Transition Plan, circuit diagrams, photographs of projects, video of working robot), and explain why having a current portfolio is important for career development and advancement.

C9934921676645259CBC7467B724164B.description: demonstrate an understanding of and apply the work habits that are important for success in the computer technology industry, as identified in the Ontario Skills Passport (e.g., working safely, teamwork, reliability, organization, working independently, initiative, self-advocacy);

F680AF3C557E418F9F47A05E4DDDEE9C.description: demonstrate an understanding of and apply the Essential Skills that are important for success in the computer technology industry, as identified in the Ontario Skills Passport (OSP) (e.g., reading text, writing, document use, computer use, oral communication, numeracy, thinking skills);

0E3C2E95BB7A4BC786E12B84C9A60ACF.description: explain the need for lifelong learning in the computer technology industry (e.g., rapid changes in technology, employability, progress into positions of greater responsibility);

D90920544FC741A1BB6436C61324B80B.description: assess various career opportunities related to computer technology and electronics(e.g., computer engineering technician or technologist, electrical engineer, programmer, systems analyst), and identify opportunities for further training and certification (e.g., college or university programs, trade certifications);

5F26C1EA6A064F78A948E0CD6DCB5AA5.description: Career Opportunities: assess career opportunities related to computer technology and electronics, and explain the importance of postsecondary education and lifelong learning in the computer technology industry.

07AA5167933E4FB29FD8F22BD7F0D92C.description: describe methods to safeguard confidential data and other sensitive electronic information (e.g., password protection, encryption, biometrics, behaviometrics, steganography).

54B1616D1B9A4BD499EC6DEDF47888C9.description: outline a purchasing policy for computers, taking ethical issues into account (e.g., the environment, human rights, child labour);

7E843C9958E44EA9AF3024BAD4EBE1BB.description: describe the components of an acceptableuse policy for computers, cellular technology, PDAs, and/or other electronic devices (e.g., appropriate use, protection of intellectual property rights, prohibition of plagiarism);

5ED605A3E3E04522A04D7ED78D847A63.description: Ethics and Security: describe ethical and security issues related to the use of computers and related technology;

60A50B1E718E46188743A1A3CB78191B.description: evaluate and use appropriate techniques to avoid health and safety problems (e.g., repetitive strain injuries, eye strain, electrical shock, burns from soldering tools) when assembling, using, and maintaining computer systems.

E50E8EE05C5F4FF4A57BC194DA089E91.description: explain the importance of following industry health and safety standards and practices (e.g., standards and regulations specified in the Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System [WHMIS] and the Electrical Safety Code; practices such as electrical grounding and precautionary measures when working with live circuits and devices that store electrical energy; ergonomically sound workplace arrangements and practices);

6F27055899554F80AF73244FD3F34457.description: Health and Safety: explain the importance of safety standards and practices, and use appropriate techniques to avoid health and safety problems;

CC3FC283DA4E4D788AD6A42CDCBC38CD.description: assess the drawbacks of computer and electronics technology for society (e.g., Internet gambling addictions, more sedentary lifestyle, spam, telemarketing, loss of privacy, infringement of intellectual property rights through unlicensed copying and electronic distribution).

99A94C73665E4DE899A2AD24DE07512A.description: assess the benefits of computer and electronic technology for society (e.g., improved access to technology for economically disadvantaged people and nations; greater efficiency and lower costs for information services; development of a “global village”; software that can help monitor or predict changes in wetland area, deforestation, and climate);

87805B22E2A24A81A8BB35EDC9800E3F.description: Technology and Society: analyse societal issues related to the widespread use of computers and associated technologies.

A198E89EF8744078AAB0B98952D48C81.description: outline and apply strategies to recycle or reuse computers and computer components (e.g., develop a local recycle/reuse program, create an in-school public awareness campaign).

C3318C54CC974640A409EA3D59BC0BAE.description: assess the effects of computer and electronics technology on the environment (e.g., hazardous materials contained in computer components, use of energy and other resources, fuel consumption and air pollution reduced by computerized trafficcontrol systems);

B397A986000F4934B7CA2B2A88E21B69.description: Technology and the Environment: analyse environmental issues related to the widespread use of computers and associated technologies, and apply strategies to reduce environmental harm from computer use;

76B95D9D952A423A980E4932F9CC3AE5.description: write a low-level program that runs on a real or simulated controller device (e.g., programmable logic controller [PLC], microcontroller, assembler simulator).

644593AEFB0F4B588580D0533670595E.description: use a design process to create a program that interacts with a real-world device (e.g., traffic light, alarm system, robot, joystick);

7B01BAAF6B894480A39F604FC98DA346.description: apply programming concepts including subroutines, parameter passing, decision and repetition structures, arrays, and character representation

90473F21EF144F0E8ED497F4BC21CBF8.description: compare low-level and high-level programming languages;

30BF867F9B794FFD9D80C1EE3E4B7DCE.description: Computer Programming: demonstrate an understanding of programming concepts, and create programs that interact with external devices.

2EC7B5D993A14E7D98DC89DBCDD6FBF4.description: apply logical troubleshooting techniques, using data from simulation and/or diagnostic tools (e.g., simulation software, packet sniffers, cable tester)

61405E6A5FC74338B3682FF627D9643F.description: configure workstations, servers, and/or networked devices (e.g., create users, assign privileges to folders, set up services, format and partition hard drives);

B4B3399310064254BECF31356FB0AFC5.description: implement various network services for users (e.g., HTTP, FTP, remote desktop, SMTP, DHCP);

6EE50C7D19C54307982320907ACA6891.description: optimize and maintain a computer network (e.g., check performance, accessibility, and security);

B6F725DAB39C4B1D97F392ED3EEAB404.description: design and build a network (e.g., connection media, interconnection devices, peripherals, server, workstations) that meets user requirements;

48976A8F39EB445BA71971EB76DB5341.description: Network Setup and Management: design, build, configure, maintain, and troubleshoot networks, and set up various network services for users

83F1FF8B1EB64DBEB520D2C463C4F82E.description: test and troubleshoot electronic circuits, using appropriate methods (e.g., isolating and substituting components) and test equipment (e.g., multimeter, oscilloscope, logic probe), and modify the circuits to meet design requirements if necessary

24D8D06ADD5048E0B69A729B89905792.description: safely construct electronic circuits for interfacing or robotic applications using appropriate materials, tools, and techniques, including soldering (e.g., materials: breadboard, printed circuit board, etchant, solder; tools: soldering iron, etch bath, third hand with magnifier);

D99A5553306047D1A07D7DF2EB5B3D28.description: construct circuits made from both discrete components and integrated circuits to perform specific functions (e.g., regulated power supply, electronic dice, audio amplifier, microcontrollerbased alarm circuit);

A50ABDCC3FF648FCB99D0E7F6B5122BA.description: use a design process (see pp. 22–23) and appropriate software (e.g., circuit simulation software, CAD [computer-aided design] software) to design circuits;

15CD2017735748B785E3E5D97486B76E.description: Electronics, Robotics, and Computer Interfacing: design, build, test, and troubleshoot interfaces and other circuits that meet specific design requirements;

305D5E244AA84BE0A37B0620F0BCFBD4.description: use a logical approach to diagnose and troubleshoot computer hardware and software problems.

D21D07200212407C86EC235B6C9E3B2C.description: create a log and/or engineering journal to document work done on computer systems (e.g., troubleshooting, software updates, hardware installations, maintenance);

E0810DF9B9AA48E6B9DB67C8F6E7C07D.description: use a variety of sources to collect information for solving computer problems (e.g., Internet searches, technical reference materials);

799F5264BA3340B39C92C1703C693D03.description: Computer Systems: maintain and troubleshoot a variety of computer hardware and software;

6DF691334DED4873AC5E127B0F6731CB.description: construct and test connection media for interfacing a computer with an external device (e.g., serial cable, parallel cable)

D14117FAACF9418D98F8AF5EC17F8B8F.description: select and use appropriate procedures, tools, and diagnostic equipment when assembling computing devices (e.g., procedures: use of anti-static wrist strap and/or mat; tools: crimper; diagnostic equipment: multimeter, cable tester, oscilloscope);

F097732922D34B13A4C7CA970C27DAFD.description: select appropriate components and build computer systems that meet specific requirements (e.g., gaming system, engineering workstation, media centre, control system, home office system);

2FACF9967C4E4D7195A4EF28F83D493C.description: Hardware Solutions: build computer systems and connection media to meet specific requirements, using appropriate procedures, tools, and equipment;

72136045AB034AB783887B01F7A96B27.description: explain how analogue quantities can be represented by digital systems (e.g., analogueto-digital converter, pulse-width modulation).

49538954FBAF4F35AD8DE367563F11EE.description: describe how computers store and work with different types of data, including numbers, characters, and arrays;

8CEE85A06DF749DD88108615B9FC13F7.description: describe the role of flip-flop circuits in the storage and flow of data (e.g., asynchronous counter, synchronous counter, shift register, memory register);

7244A0AA1A38470286EA6C52BB4434D3.description: use Boolean logic and the laws of Boolean algebra to design, simplify, and build computer logic circuits using logic gates (e.g., adder circuit, decoder circuit);

EE1540C66605478E8B3B53194BA4AEAF.description: use Boolean logic (e.g., Karnaugh maps) to design a solution to a logic problem that has multiple inputs and outputs (e.g., manufacturing process, starting a car);

A7CC85CCF8594F62992D9572E2DABC31.description: perform arithmetic operations on positive and negative binary numbers (e.g., addition, subtraction) using two’s complement representation;

73D3F6E77C4F431BBF66100A3A879FA3.description: Data Representation and Digital Logic: demonstrate an understanding of computer logic circuits and the representation, manipulation, and transmission of data by computers.

264B8D9D28F745B9B788962AFC5B50C6.description: describe static and dynamic classful public and private addressing and related strategies (e.g., Class A, Class B, Class C, NAT, PAT, DHCP).

AAF4823CA33544699BD162011E325F5D.description: describe IP addressing and subnetting strategies for IP networks (e.g., borrowing bits, calculating number of subnets and hosts, determining specific subnet address range);

BE9B440508364997A50EF708318A7160.description: explain the seven layers of the OSI (open systems interconnection) model and the corresponding network devices;

6475BFA02AF44A1F9CEC43A59740D164.description: describe the function of routed protocols (e.g., IP, IPX) and routing protocols (e.g., RIP, OSPF, EIGRP) in the transmission of data over a network;

CF624D34AA5A4FF2A9EC0C3448EF5744.description: Networking Concepts: demonstrate an understanding of network addressing and routing

794D75632E3D426293ACB4A2E24B59FD.description: research and select components based on circuit requirements (e.g., use Internet searches, manufacturer’s data sheets, supplier catalogues, and/or parts database).

87704DF866E647629603B51E7FE848D7.description: draw and interpret diagrams that use standard symbols to represent electronic components and the operation of control systems (e.g., schematic diagram, block diagram, flow chart);

1B5728AAD8834296958FF081138C283C.description: calculate the values and operating parameters of electronic components in a circuit, using fundamental laws and circuit-analysis techniques (e.g., Ohm’s law, Kirchhoff’s laws, Thévenin and Norton equivalent circuits);

D009CF33FD474CB895932A9124541B41.description: describe the function and operation of various input devices, output devices, and electronic circuits used in interface and control systems (e.g., input devices: temperature sensor, light sensor, position encoder; output devices: AC motor, stepper motor; circuits: power supply, motor driver);

58949BC998AD400FA988D18A4A5A370F.description: use technical terminology to accurately describe the specifications for electronic components and computer interfaces;

C0B94E02241A43E2B09B5CD1BC21EA35.description: Electronics, Robotics, and Computer Interfacing: demonstrate an understanding of devices and electronic circuits in interfaces and control systems

1ED4AC91819E419E851DC61B3138A5FD.description: describe various standards for data flow between computer ports and peripherals (e.g., MIDI, RS-232, USB, IEEE 1394, SCSI).

0511A2CCCCFC4BD584C5D25452FBB10C.description: describe the functions of the BIOS and other firmware in computer systems (e.g., boot process, hardware recognition, resource allocation, port settings, energy management);

735A9383B68D4F52814A9726C363378F.description: describe methods for optimizing a computer system (e.g., updating firmware, updating drivers, defragmenting files, allocating virtual memory);

F2A13CA93EAD4FA895BAAF4FF4996B6E.description: describe how to assign permissions and attributes to drives, folders, and files with various operating systems (e.g., user permissions, archiving, encryption, compression);

CEAEA241358143AF96F9632306D1D98D.description: Computer Systems: demonstrate an understanding of system optimization and of permissions, attributes, firmware, and communication standards used in computer systems

88FB120BE0C24459BD632FEFB8D18C7B.description: describe how advances in computer technology (e.g., CPUs, memory, storage) have spurred advances in related technologies (e.g., cellular telephones, hand-held devices, image capture systems).

DE61B0B8404041BBB00656720854251C.description: identify appropriate storage devices for various computing requirements (e.g., optical drives, flash drives, single and arrayed hard drives);

28AE5ED61ABE439F8023E43B2153D3DD.description: describe the function of internal buses within computer systems (e.g., data bus; memory bus; address bus; buses in CPUs, RAM, and chipsets)

4E166532D4E84BD0819E2D9DD74E52BE.description: Computer Hardware: demonstrate an understanding of internal buses and storage devices, and of advances in computer technology
